content.text: Found one file with `source_node_id` references. Let me examine it:

content.content:
1→---
     2→title: "Webhooks"
     3→description: "Connect external systems to your agents using webhook endpoints"
     4→icon: "webhook"
     5→---
     6→
     7→Webhooks enable you to trigger xpander.ai agents from any external system that can make HTTP requests. Each agent has a unique webhook URL for programmatic interaction.
     8→
     9→## Accessing Your Webhook URL
    10→
    11→<Frame caption="Agent Builder Interface">
    12→![Agent Builder Interface](/static/images/screenshots/36DB40C0-7033-4F84-8CB8-EA1FAD14C561.png)
    13→</Frame>
    14→
    15→To find your webhook URL:
    16→1. Navigate to your agent in the AI Agent Workbench
    17→2. Click the "Webhook" trigger in the top of the graph
    18→3. The Webhook Configuration panel will open, providing:
    19→   - Ready-to-use code snippets
    20→   - Configuration instructions
    21→   - Testing capabilities
    22→   - Webhook management options
    23→
    24→<Frame caption="Webhook Configuration Interface">
    25→![Webhook Configuration Interface](/static/images/screenshots/AECAB014-E97A-4D2C-BEDF-64118F45BD4D.png)
    26→</Frame>
    27→
    28→## Making Webhook Requests
    29→
    30→### Required Parameters
    31→
    32→| Parameter | Type | Description |
    33→| --------- | ---- | ----------- |
    34→| `agent_id` | string | The unique identifier of your agent |
    35→| `source_node_id` | string | The starting node ID in your agent's workflow |
    36→| `x-api-key` | string | Your API key for authentication (header or query parameter) |
    37→| `asynchronous` | boolean | Whether to wait for completion (`false`) or return immediately (`true`) |
    38→
    39→### Request Body Options
    40→
    41→| Option | Type | Description |
    42→| ------ | ---- | ----------- |
    43→| `files` | file | One or more files to process (PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP) |
    44→| `prompt` | string | A text prompt to send to the agent |
    45→
    46→<Warning>
    47→When uploading files, you must send the actual files using `multipart/form-data`. Direct external URLs to files are not supported as inputs. The platform will generate secure presigned URLs for your agent to access the uploaded files.
    48→</Warning>
    49→
    50→### Content Types
    51→
    52→- **With files**: Use `multipart/form-data` (curl handles this automatically with `--form`)
    53→- **JSON only**: Use `application/json` with the appropriate header
    54→
    55→## File Handling
    56→
    57→### Supported File Types
    58→
    59→xpander.ai supports a variety of file formats:
    60→- Documents: PDF
    61→- Images: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP
    62→
    63→### Uploading Multiple Files
    64→
    65→To process multiple files in a single request:
    66→
    67→```bash
    68→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
    69→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
    70→--form "prompt=Process these documents" \
    71→--form "files=@/path/to/first-file.pdf" \
    72→--form "files=@/path/to/second-file.pdf" \
    73→--form "files=@/path/to/image.png" \
    74→--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
    75→--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
    76→```
    77→
    78→For large batches of files (10+ files), we recommend:
    79→1. Using asynchronous mode (`asynchronous=true`)
    80→2. Breaking uploads into multiple requests of 5-10 files each
    81→3. Using a dedicated file uploader with retry capabilities
    82→
    83→### File URL Mechanism
    84→
    85→When you upload files through the webhook:
    86→
    87→1. xpander.ai automatically handles storage of your files
    88→2. Your agent receives secure presigned URLs to access these files
    89→3. These URLs remain valid for 30 days after upload
    90→4. Files are accessible only to your organization's agents
    91→
    92→<Info>
    93→All uploaded files are stored securely on our platform. Your agent doesn't need to handle file storage or download logic - it will automatically receive properly formatted URLs to access the files.
    94→</Info>
    95→
    96→## Synchronous vs Asynchronous Requests
    97→
    98→### Synchronous Mode
    99→
   100→```bash
   101→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
   102→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
   103→--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
   104→--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
   105→```
   106→
   107→- HTTP request remains open until agent completes
   108→- Returns complete execution details and results
   109→- Best for immediate responses and short tasks
   110→
   111→**Response:**
   112→
   113→```json
   114→{
   115→  "result": {
   116→    "id": "9642f5dd-e535-465f-bdaf-89be6ecaa2d5",
   117→    "status": "completed",
   118→    "result": "I specialize in extracting text from image and PDF files using Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology. If you provide me with a file in a supported format (pdf, png, jpeg, gif, webp), I can extract the text content for you.",
   119→    "source": "webhook"
   120→  }
   121→}
   122→```
   123→
   124→### Asynchronous Mode
   125→
   126→```bash
   127→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
   128→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
   129→--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
   130→--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
   131→```
   132→
   133→- Returns immediately while agent processes in background
   134→- Best for long-running tasks and large file processing
   135→- Allows your application to continue execution
   136→
   137→**Response:**
   138→
   139→```json
   140→{
   141→  "result": "Started"
   142→}
   143→```
   144→
   145→## Example: OCR Document Processing
   146→
   147→This example shows how to extract text from a document using the OCR agent:
   148→
   149→```bash
   150→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
   151→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
   152→--form "prompt=Extract text from this document" \
   153→--form "files=@/path/to/your/document.pdf" \
   154→--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
   155→--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
   156→```
   157→
   158→<Info>
   159→The OCR agent handles multiple document formats (PDFs and images) and preserves formatting when possible, including tables and structured content.
   160→</Info>
   161→
   162→### Sample OCR Result
   163→
   164→```json
   165→{
   166→  "result": {
   167→    "id": "07d6f375-53e9-4aa3-a7af-c36ce99a07d8",
   168→    "status": "completed",
   169→    "result": "## Financial Statement\n\n## ACCOUNT SUMMARY FOR PERIOD ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2024\n\n| Description | Amount | Percentage |\n|------------|--------|------------|\n| Opening Balance | 50,000 | - |\n| Deposits | 25,000 | - |\n| Withdrawals | (10,000) | - |\n| Fees | (1,500) | 3% |\n| Interest | 1,200 | 2.4% |\n| Closing Balance | 64,700 | - |",
   170→    "source": "webhook"
   171→  }
   172→}
   173→```
   174→
   175→## Monitoring Webhook Activity
   176→
   177→xpander.ai provides a comprehensive monitoring interface for webhook calls:
   178→
   179→<Frame caption="Webhook Monitoring Interface">
   180→![OCR Agent Monitoring Interface](/static/images/screenshots/858B1698-A13F-4B6B-9ADB-71629B4BD261.png)
   181→</Frame>
   182→
   183→The monitoring dashboard displays:
   184→- Complete execution logs
   185→- File processing details
   186→- Performance metrics
   187→- Full request/response data
   188→
   189→## Common Use Cases
   190→
   191→<CardGroup cols={2}>
   192→  <Card title="Workflow Automation" icon="robot">
   193→    Integrate with platforms like Zapier, Make.com, or n8n to trigger document processing based on external events.
   194→  </Card>
   195→  
   196→  <Card title="Document Processing" icon="file-pdf">
   197→    Extract structured data from documents to automate data entry and analysis workflows.
   198→  </Card>
   199→</CardGroup>

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

1→---
     2→title: "Quickstart - CLI"
     3→description: "Get started with xpander.ai and build your first AI agent"
     4→icon: "terminal"
     5→---
     6→
     7→## Installation and Configuration
     8→
     9→<Steps>
    10→  <Step title="Install the CLI">
    11→    Install the xpander CLI globally:
    12→
    13→    ```bash
    14→    npm install -g xpander-cli
    15→    ```
    16→  </Step>
    17→
    18→  <Step title="Configure your credentials">
    19→    Set up your API key and organization:
    20→
    21→    ```bash
    22→    xpander configure
    23→    ```
    24→
    25→    <Accordion title="Example configuration output">
    26→    ```

    28→    ? Would you like to configure your credentials now? Yes
    29→    ? Enter your Xpander API key: IhPLk2Cu5BXw5BmVBhld3p31mTpAxC892pD6O5E3
    30→    API Key: IhPL...O5E3 (first and last 4 characters shown)
    31→    ✔ API key validation successful
    32→    API key saved to profile "default".
    33→    Organization ID will be auto-detected for you now...
    34→    ⠏ Detecting organization ID...Organization ID detected: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb
    35→    Organization ID saved to profile "default".
    36→    ✔ Organization ID detected: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb
    37→    Found 1 agent(s) in your organization.
    38→    Set "default" as the default profile.
    39→    Credentials stored at: /Users/david/.xpander/credentials
    40→    Profile: default
    41→
    42→    Configuration successful.
    43→    ```
    44→    </Accordion>
    45→  </Step>
    46→</Steps>
    47→
    48→## Creating Your First Agent
    49→
    50→<Steps>
    51→  <Step title="Create a new agent">
    52→    Create your agent using the CLI:
    53→
    54→    ```bash
    55→    xpander agent new
    56→    ```
    57→
    58→    <Accordion title="Example agent creation output">
    59→    ```
    60→    ✨ Agent Creation Wizard ✨
    61→    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    62→    Create a powerful AI agent for your organization
    63→    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    64→
    65→    ? What name would you like for your agent? my-first-agent
    66→    ⠋ Creating agent "my-first-agent"...Creating agent in organization: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb...
    67→    ✔ Agent "my-first-agent" created successfully!
    68→
    69→    🚀 Your Agent is Ready!
    70→    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    71→    Name:     my-first-agent
    72→    ID:       4fe1163d-bb00-4837-9e25-6f82aed8038c
    73→    Icon:     🚀
    74→    Model:    openai/gpt-4.1
    75→    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    76→
    77→    ✅ Agent creation complete!
    78→
    79→    ? Do you want to load this agent into your current workdir? Yes
    80→
    81→
    82→    ✨ Initializing agent
    83→    ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    84→    ℹ Agent my-first-agent retrieved successfully
    85→    ? The current directory is not empty. Proceeding will override 'requirements.txt' and add or update xpander-related files (xpander_config.json, 
    86→    agent_instructions.json, etc). Yes
    87→    ✔ Agent initialized successfully
    88→    ```
    89→    </Accordion>
    90→  </Step>
    91→
    92→  <Step title="Configure environment variables">
    93→    Create a `.env` file in the root directory with the following credentials:
    94→
    95→    ```txt .env file
    96→    XPANDER_API_KEY=your_xpander_api_key  # From the xpander login output
    97→    OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
    98→    OPENAI_MODEL_ID=gpt-4.1
    99→    ```
   100→  </Step>
   101→</Steps>
   102→
   103→## Working with Your Agent
   104→
   105→With your agent created, you can now work with it in several ways:
   106→
   107→1. **Using the SDK in your code**: Implement the agent loop and integrate with your application
   108→2. **Stream events from the cloud**: Set up a handler to receive events from xpander.ai
   109→3. **Deploy to the cloud**: Host your agent in the xpander.ai cloud
   110→
   111→For detailed code examples and step-by-step implementation instructions, see our dedicated [Instrument & Run AI Agents](/docs/01-get-started/03-instrument-agents) guide.
   112→

file.content:
---
title: "Quickstart - CLI"
description: "Get started with xpander.ai and build your first AI agent"
icon: "terminal"
---

## Installation and Configuration

<Steps>
  <Step title="Install the CLI">
    Install the xpander CLI globally:

    ```bash
    npm install -g xpander-cli
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Configure your credentials">
    Set up your API key and organization:

    ```bash
    xpander configure
    ```

    <Accordion title="Example configuration output">
    ```
    You need to configure your credentials to use the Xpander CLI.
    ? Would you like to configure your credentials now? Yes
    ? Enter your Xpander API key: IhPLk2Cu5BXw5BmVBhld3p31mTpAxC892pD6O5E3
    API Key: IhPL...O5E3 (first and last 4 characters shown)
    ✔ API key validation successful
    API key saved to profile "default".
    Organization ID will be auto-detected for you now...
    ⠏ Detecting organization ID...Organization ID detected: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb
    Organization ID saved to profile "default".
    ✔ Organization ID detected: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb
    Found 1 agent(s) in your organization.
    Set "default" as the default profile.
    Credentials stored at: /Users/david/.xpander/credentials
    Profile: default

    Configuration successful.
    ```
    </Accordion>
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Creating Your First Agent

<Steps>
  <Step title="Create a new agent">
    Create your agent using the CLI:

    ```bash
    xpander agent new
    ```

    <Accordion title="Example agent creation output">
    ```
    ✨ Agent Creation Wizard ✨
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    Create a powerful AI agent for your organization
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────

    ? What name would you like for your agent? my-first-agent
    ⠋ Creating agent "my-first-agent"...Creating agent in organization: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb...
    ✔ Agent "my-first-agent" created successfully!

    🚀 Your Agent is Ready!
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    Name:     my-first-agent
    ID:       4fe1163d-bb00-4837-9e25-6f82aed8038c
    Icon:     🚀
    Model:    openai/gpt-4.1
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────

    ✅ Agent creation complete!

    ? Do you want to load this agent into your current workdir? Yes


    ✨ Initializing agent
    ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    ℹ Agent my-first-agent retrieved successfully
    ? The current directory is not empty. Proceeding will override 'requirements.txt' and add or update xpander-related files (xpander_config.json, 
    agent_instructions.json, etc). Yes
    ✔ Agent initialized successfully
    ```
    </Accordion>
  </Step>

  <Step title="Configure environment variables">
    Create a `.env` file in the root directory with the following credentials:

    ```txt .env file
    XPANDER_API_KEY=your_xpander_api_key  # From the xpander login output
    OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
    OPENAI_MODEL_ID=gpt-4.1
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Working with Your Agent

With your agent created, you can now work with it in several ways:

1. **Using the SDK in your code**: Implement the agent loop and integrate with your application
2. **Stream events from the cloud**: Set up a handler to receive events from xpander.ai
3. **Deploy to the cloud**: Host your agent in the xpander.ai cloud

For detailed code examples and step-by-step implementation instructions, see our dedicated [Instrument & Run AI Agents](/docs/01-get-started/03-instrument-agents) guide.

input.old_string: For detailed code examples and step-by-step implementation instructions, see our dedicated [Instrument & Run AI Agents](/docs/01-get-started/03-instrument-agents) guide.
input.new_string:
For detailed code examples and step-by-step implementation instructions, see our dedicated [Instrument & Run AI Agents](/docs/01-get-started/03-instrument-agents) guide.

## Troubleshooting Common CLI Issues

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="CLI command not found after installation">
    If you get a "command not found" error after installing the CLI:
    
    **Solution:**
    1. Verify the installation completed successfully:
       ```bash
       npm list -g xpander-cli
       ```
    2. Check your PATH includes npm global binaries:
       ```bash
       npm config get prefix
       ```
    3. Restart your terminal or reload your shell configuration
    4. If using nvm, ensure you're using the correct Node.js version
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="API key validation failed">
    If your API key validation fails during configuration:
    
    **Possible causes and solutions:**
    - **Invalid API key**: Double-check your API key from the xpander.ai dashboard
    - **Network issues**: Verify your internet connection and proxy settings
    - **Expired key**: Generate a new API key if yours has expired
    - **Incorrect formatting**: Ensure no extra spaces or characters in the key
    
    **Debugging steps:**
    ```bash
    # View current configuration
    xpander config show
    
    # Reconfigure with verbose output
    xpander configure --verbose
    ```
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Organization ID detection failed">
    If the CLI cannot detect your organization ID:
    
    **Solution:**
    1. Manually set your organization ID:
       ```bash
       xpander config set organization-id YOUR_ORG_ID
       ```
    2. You can find your organization ID in the xpander.ai web dashboard
    3. Verify your API key has the correct permissions for your organization
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Agent creation fails">
    If `xpander agent new` fails or hangs:
    
    **Common solutions:**
    - **Check permissions**: Ensure your API key has agent creation permissions
    - **Network timeout**: Try again with a stable internet connection
    - **Directory permissions**: Verify write permissions in the current directory
    - **Clear cache**: Clear any cached credentials and reconfigure:
      ```bash
      rm -rf ~/.xpander/cache
      xpander configure
      ```
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Environment variable issues">
    If your agent can't access required environment variables:
    
    **Checklist:**
    1. Verify `.env` file exists in the correct directory
    2. Check variable names match exactly (case-sensitive)
    3. Ensure no quotes around values unless needed
    4. Restart your development server after changes
    5. For production, verify environment variables are set in your deployment platform
    
    **Example `.env` validation:**
    ```bash
    # Check if .env file exists and is readable
    ls -la .env
    cat .env
    ```
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Permission denied errors">
    If you encounter permission errors:
    
    **Solutions:**
    - **Global installation**: Use `sudo` on macOS/Linux if needed:
      ```bash
      sudo npm install -g xpander-cli
      ```
    - **Use npx**: Run without global installation:
      ```bash
      npx xpander-cli configure
      ```
    - **Check directory permissions**: Ensure write access to the working directory
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Version compatibility issues">
    If you experience unexpected behavior:
    
    **Update to latest version:**
    ```bash
    npm update -g xpander-cli
    xpander --version
    ```
    
    **Check for breaking changes:**
    - Review the [changelog](https://github.com/xpander-ai/xpander-cli/releases)
    - Ensure your API version is compatible
    - Update your agent configuration if needed
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

### Getting Additional Help

If you continue to experience issues:

1. **Check the documentation**: Visit [docs.xpander.ai](https://docs.xpander.ai) for the latest guides
2. **Community support**: Join our Discord server for community help
3. **Report bugs**: Create an issue on our [GitHub repository](https://github.com/xpander-ai/xpander-cli)
4. **Contact support**: Reach out to our support team for enterprise customers

<Tip>
Enable verbose logging to get more detailed error information:
```bash
xpander --verbose [command]
```
</Tip>

For detailed code examples and step-by-step implementation instructions, see our dedicated [Instrument & Run AI Agents](/docs/01-get-started/03-instrument-agents) guide.

## Troubleshooting Common CLI Issues

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="CLI command not found after installation">
    If you get a "command not found" error after installing the CLI:
    
    **Solution:**
    1. Verify the installation completed successfully:
       ```bash
       npm list -g xpander-cli
       ```
    2. Check your PATH includes npm global binaries:
       ```bash
       npm config get prefix
       ```
    3. Restart your terminal or reload your shell configuration
    4. If using nvm, ensure you're using the correct Node.js version
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="API key validation failed">
    If your API key validation fails during configuration:
    
    **Possible causes and solutions:**
    - **Invalid API key**: Double-check your API key from the xpander.ai dashboard
    - **Network issues**: Verify your internet connection and proxy settings
    - **Expired key**: Generate a new API key if yours has expired
    - **Incorrect formatting**: Ensure no extra spaces or characters in the key
    
    **Debugging steps:**
    ```bash
    # View current configuration
    xpander config show
    
    # Reconfigure with verbose output
    xpander configure --verbose
    ```
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Organization ID detection failed">
    If the CLI cannot detect your organization ID:
    
    **Solution:**
    1. Manually set your organization ID:
       ```bash
       xpander config set organization-id YOUR_ORG_ID
       ```
    2. You can find your organization ID in the xpander.ai web dashboard
    3. Verify your API key has the correct permissions for your organization
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Agent creation fails">
    If `xpander agent new` fails or hangs:
    
    **Common solutions:**
    - **Check permissions**: Ensure your API key has agent creation permissions
    - **Network timeout**: Try again with a stable internet connection
    - **Directory permissions**: Verify write permissions in the current directory
    - **Clear cache**: Clear any cached credentials and reconfigure:
      ```bash
      rm -rf ~/.xpander/cache
      xpander configure
      ```
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Environment variable issues">
    If your agent can't access required environment variables:
    
    **Checklist:**
    1. Verify `.env` file exists in the correct directory
    2. Check variable names match exactly (case-sensitive)
    3. Ensure no quotes around values unless needed
    4. Restart your development server after changes
    5. For production, verify environment variables are set in your deployment platform
    
    **Example `.env` validation:**
    ```bash
    # Check if .env file exists and is readable
    ls -la .env
    cat .env
    ```
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Permission denied errors">
    If you encounter permission errors:
    
    **Solutions:**
    - **Global installation**: Use `sudo` on macOS/Linux if needed:
      ```bash
      sudo npm install -g xpander-cli
      ```
    - **Use npx**: Run without global installation:
      ```bash
      npx xpander-cli configure
      ```
    - **Check directory permissions**: Ensure write access to the working directory
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Version compatibility issues">
    If you experience unexpected behavior:
    
    **Update to latest version:**
    ```bash
    npm update -g xpander-cli
    xpander --version
    ```
    
    **Check for breaking changes:**
    - Review the [changelog](https://github.com/xpander-ai/xpander-cli/releases)
    - Ensure your API version is compatible
    - Update your agent configuration if needed
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

### Getting Additional Help

If you continue to experience issues:

1. **Check the documentation**: Visit [docs.xpander.ai](https://docs.xpander.ai) for the latest guides
2. **Community support**: Join our Discord server for community help
3. **Report bugs**: Create an issue on our [GitHub repository](https://github.com/xpander-ai/xpander-cli)
4. **Contact support**: Reach out to our support team for enterprise customers

<Tip>
Enable verbose logging to get more detailed error information:
```bash
xpander --verbose [command]
```
</Tip>
toolUseResult.originalFile:
---
title: "Quickstart - CLI"
description: "Get started with xpander.ai and build your first AI agent"
icon: "terminal"
---

## Installation and Configuration

<Steps>
  <Step title="Install the CLI">
    Install the xpander CLI globally:

    ```bash
    npm install -g xpander-cli
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Configure your credentials">
    Set up your API key and organization:

    ```bash
    xpander configure
    ```

    <Accordion title="Example configuration output">
    ```
    You need to configure your credentials to use the Xpander CLI.
    ? Would you like to configure your credentials now? Yes
    ? Enter your Xpander API key: IhPLk2Cu5BXw5BmVBhld3p31mTpAxC892pD6O5E3
    API Key: IhPL...O5E3 (first and last 4 characters shown)
    ✔ API key validation successful
    API key saved to profile "default".
    Organization ID will be auto-detected for you now...
    ⠏ Detecting organization ID...Organization ID detected: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb
    Organization ID saved to profile "default".
    ✔ Organization ID detected: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb
    Found 1 agent(s) in your organization.
    Set "default" as the default profile.
    Credentials stored at: /Users/david/.xpander/credentials
    Profile: default

    Configuration successful.
    ```
    </Accordion>
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Creating Your First Agent

<Steps>
  <Step title="Create a new agent">
    Create your agent using the CLI:

    ```bash
    xpander agent new
    ```

    <Accordion title="Example agent creation output">
    ```
    ✨ Agent Creation Wizard ✨
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    Create a powerful AI agent for your organization
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────

    ? What name would you like for your agent? my-first-agent
    ⠋ Creating agent "my-first-agent"...Creating agent in organization: 8d185373-8b24-47a7-8607-3e9036b968bb...
    ✔ Agent "my-first-agent" created successfully!

    🚀 Your Agent is Ready!
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────
    Name:     my-first-agent
    ID:       4fe1163d-bb00-4837-9e25-6f82aed8038c
    Icon:     🚀
    Model:    openai/gpt-4.1
    ──────────────────────────────────────────────────

    ✅ Agent creation complete!

    ? Do you want to load this agent into your current workdir? Yes


    ✨ Initializing agent
    ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    ℹ Agent my-first-agent retrieved successfully
    ? The current directory is not empty. Proceeding will override 'requirements.txt' and add or update xpander-related files (xpander_config.json, 
    agent_instructions.json, etc). Yes
    ✔ Agent initialized successfully
    ```
    </Accordion>
  </Step>

  <Step title="Configure environment variables">
    Create a `.env` file in the root directory with the following credentials:

    ```txt .env file
    XPANDER_API_KEY=your_xpander_api_key  # From the xpander login output
    OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key
    OPENAI_MODEL_ID=gpt-4.1
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Working with Your Agent

With your agent created, you can now work with it in several ways:

1. **Using the SDK in your code**: Implement the agent loop and integrate with your application
2. **Stream events from the cloud**: Set up a handler to receive events from xpander.ai
3. **Deploy to the cloud**: Host your agent in the xpander.ai cloud

For detailed code examples and step-by-step implementation instructions, see our dedicated [Instrument & Run AI Agents](/docs/01-get-started/03-instrument-agents) guide.

+    4. If using nvm, ensure you're using the correct Node.js version
+    If your API key validation fails during configuration:

+    - **Network issues**: Verify your internet connection and proxy settings
+    - **Expired key**: Generate a new API key if yours has expired
+    - **Incorrect formatting**: Ensure no extra spaces or characters in the key
+    If the CLI cannot detect your organization ID:
+    2. You can find your organization ID in the xpander.ai web dashboard
+    3. Verify your API key has the correct permissions for your organization
+    If `xpander agent new` fails or hangs:
+    - **Check permissions**: Ensure your API key has agent creation permissions
+    - **Network timeout**: Try again with a stable internet connection
+    - **Directory permissions**: Verify write permissions in the current directory

+    If your agent can't access required environment variables:
+    1. Verify `.env` file exists in the correct directory
+    3. Ensure no quotes around values unless needed
+    4. Restart your development server after changes
+    5. For production, verify environment variables are set in your deployment platform

+    - **Check directory permissions**: Ensure write access to the working directory
+    - Ensure your API version is compatible
+    - Update your agent configuration if needed
+1. **Check the documentation**: Visit [docs.xpander.ai](https://docs.xpander.ai) for the latest guides

+4. **Contact support**: Reach out to our support team for enterprise customers

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully added a comprehensive troubleshooting section to the CLI getting started documentation at `docs/01-get-started/02-getting-started-02-cli.mdx:113-240`. 

The troubleshooting section includes:
- 7 common CLI issues with detailed solutions
- Installation and command not found problems
- API key validation failures
- Organization ID detection issues
- Agent creation failures
- Environment variable problems
- Permission errors
- Version compatibility issues

The changes have been committed to the existing PR branch `fix-issue-75-fresh` and complement the existing work on issue #75.
